brainly_data.question:
The Following Questions Pertain to Java (60pts)

1 - 
Which of the following is the java keyword used to declare a class?
- class
- object
- instance
- instantiate

2 - 
Which statement about constructors is false?
- A constructor is invoked to create a new object
- A constructor has the same name as the class to which it belongs
- A constructor can have any return type
- A class can have more than one constructor

3 - 
A class may declare variables that instances of the class will have. However, each instance can have different values assigned to those variables. Which term best describes these variables?
- primitive variables
- class variables
- reference variables
- instance variables

4 -
Which type of variable holds reference to an object?
- instance variable
- reference variable
- primitive variable
- class variable

5 -
Which of the following is the java keyword to create an object?
- create
- original
- new
- make

Any help would be much appreciated, given I am god awful with computer languages.
brainly_data.subject: Computers and technology

all_answers.question:
The Following Questions Pertain to Java (60pts)

1 -

2 -

- A constructor is invoked to create a new object
- A constructor has the same name as the class to which it belongs
- A constructor can have any return type
- A class can have more than one constructor

3 - 
A class may declare variables that instances of the class will have. However, each instance can have different values assigned to those variables. Which term best describes these variables?
- primitive variables
- class variables
- reference variables
- instance variables

4 -
Which type of variable holds reference to an object?
- instance variable
- reference variable
- primitive variable
- class variable

5 -

- original
- new
- make

Any help would be much appreciated, given I am god awful with computer languages.
all_answers.subject: Computers and technology
all_answers.text:
1) a
2) c 
3) d
4) b 
5) c
 i think i hope it helps
